CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mary Jean Brown, 7323 Hamilton Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should immediately enforce the Supreme Court's recent decision in 'Little Rock School Case' or permit the recalcitrant states to take their time in obeying?" answer reads: "By all means, the Federal Government should enforce the ruling in this situation...We are all human beings and color should not matter."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Jean Brown wearing light colored hat, earrings, and light colored coat with fur trim, holding dark handbag, standing in front of light colored stone building
